Item.Name: Beyond Poseidon Adventure Pressbook Scuba
Item.Description: You are viewing a huge pressbook from the movie Beyond the Poseidon Adventure . This 24 page book measures 13 1/2 x 18 1/2. The pressbook has articles on all of the main stars, how they filmed this movie and the dangers involved. There is a history of the Great Seas Disasters, an untouched crossword puzzle, and many pages on how to market the movie and products involved to help cinemas do so. This pressbook is one on the nicest I have seen. The top/bottom of the left side and bottom is a little creased. The inside is in very good condition. Successful bidder will pay $7.00 for airmail within N.A. or $12.00 for international orders. Preferred payment is either by CASH or BIDPAY - where item is mailed immediately or by an INTERNATIONAL MONEY ORDER (US only ones will be returned if sent as they are not negoitable in Canada) or PERSONAL CHEQUE - ONLY with a positive rating of over 100 and NO negatives. Thanks for looking.

Item.Name: Titanic Leo and Kate Picture Frame Poster
Item.Description: Titanic Leo and Kate Picture Frame Poster Mint condition, full colour 23" x 35" (58cm x 89cm) English Import poster, featuring a portrait of Leonardo DiCaprio (Jack) greeting Kate Winslett (Rose) at the bottom of the staircase. The poster for sale here is in Mint/Unused condition. It has never been folded or displayed in any way. Dec 2nd 2001 : Holiday Shipping: We ship all orders with 2-3 business days from receipt of payment, and will continue to do so during this Holiday Season. For those customers who are bidding close to Christmas, we are offering the following guarantees: 1) All customers whose posters are shipped on the 17th,18th,19th & 20th of Dec. will be emailed a USPS tacking number the same day their poster is mailed 2) All Auctions that are paid in FULL by 2pm EST on Thursday December 20th 2001 will be mailed that same day, i.e. : If we get your payment on the 20th, your poster will ship that day, and a tracking number will be e-mailed to once it has been shipped. Our office will be CLOSED Friday Dec. 21st - Wednesday Dec. 26th, we will reopen at 10 am on Dec. 27th. Auction Images/Photographs: Some of the images that we use are taken with a digital camera, and as a result can contain some flash spots and/or appear blurred. In most cases the photograph does not do the poster justice. The poster itself is crystal clear, the images are sharp, the colors are vivid and all text is crisp and 100% legible. Postage & Delivery Information: Winners within the 50 United States, Canada and Mexico, will pay $ 6.00 for shipping via the USPS's Priority Mail Service. This price includes Web traceable USPS Delivery Confirmation for US buyers. You might think that this is expensive, however the stamp costs $ 3.50, Delivery Confirmation $ 0.40 and the plastic crush proof mailing tube costs $ 1.50. If you need your poster "Expressed", we will be more than happy to quote you a UPS "Red Label" rate. To ensure that you receive your poster promptly, we endevour to ship all orders within 2-3 business days of receipt of payment. International Orders are Welcome: Airmail Rates: (4-7 Business Days) Western Europe $ 9.00, South America $ 9.00, Pacific Rim $ 10.00. Express Mail Rates: (2-3 Business Days) Western Europe $ 26.00, South America $ 26.00, Pacific Rim $ 23.00. If your country is not listed in the groupings above, then please e-mail us, and we will be more than happy to provide you with the Airmail postage rate. How we pack and Ship Your Poster: Each poster that we sell is carefully rolled inside protective clear plastic sleeving then placed inside a custom cut length of indestructible PVC plumbing pipe. The pipe is then sealed closed on each end, addressed and is now ready to wing it 's way to you. Payment for your poster: We accept payment via; Paypal, US Postal Money Orders, International Bank drafts/cheques in US Dollars and International Postal Money Orders. We will accept payment in CASH in any local currency, but we advise that you send any CASH payments via Registered Mail. After January 1st 2002 it is still OK to send European currency (FF,DM's etc ) AND Euros. Please feel free to e-mail us at Ebay@moroney.com with any questions that you might have. Remember to check out our other auctions for more rarities, as multiple orders will save on shipping!! After the Auction: Auction Winners will be automatically e-mailed a Winning Bid Letter, detailing the Final Price, North American postage cost, full Paypal details and our physical mailing address. Depending on how fast our mailing site is working, this e-mail should arrive anywhere from 3 minutes or 3 hours after the end of the Auction. Please do not use E-bay's Checkout Service, as is causes unnecessary e-mails & delays on our end. Thank you for looking at this Auction, and best of luck. Free Counter Provided by the Shops at Shoporium.com(tm) Free Software to Submit this Auction provided by Auction Submit (tm)

Item.Name: c.1910 Rosebud Sterling Baby Spoon
Item.Description: Rosebud From the Sterling Silver Manufacturing Company, circa 1910, a classicly elegant little baby spoon. Spoon is 3" long, 1-1/4" at the widest. It is marked with the tradename "Rosebud" in script, as well as the standard hallmark of a delicate rosebud, and "STERLING", all in caps. According to "American Silver Flatware 1860 to 1910" the Rosebud name was used by Sterling, and the guide gives date of manufacture as 1910. Spoon is in excellent condition with only very light scratches, but no dings, dents, or bends. I offer a satisfaction guarantee, so please bid with confidence. Payment Terms Winning U.S. bidder to pay $4.00 for Priority Mail shipping and insurance costs. International shipping priced upon request. Item.Name: THE NANNY BETTE DAVIS LOBBY CARD ORIGINAL
Item.Description: THE NANNY BETTE DAVIS LOBBY CARD ORIGINAL (Click to Enlarge) Description THE NANNY BETTE DAVIS LOBBY CARD ORIGINAL. Up for auction is the original lobby card for the 1965 British (a Hammer film) thriller The Nanny, starring the extraordinary Bette Davis in a chilling performance that only an actress of her stature could perform. The card itself, number 2 of the set, features Miss Davis with her charge. This lobby card is in black and white, with a striking red border. The lobby card is in good condition, but not perfect. There are a few pinholes (margin only); an inch tear on the upper right margin, and is a bit worn. Otherwise, it is a nice specimen. The lobby card retains its beautiful color and the paper is real smooth. It measures 14 x 11 inches. What is great about movie lobby cards compared to movie posters is that they are compact; easily and cheaply frame-able; affordable; and small enough to hang on a wall without overpowering wall space. They make a very good investment too, since lobby cards are slowing becoming extinct as a result of videos being used to advertise movies. This piece of movie memorabilia is a definitely a must-have. They make a GREAT gift too! Payment and Shipping The winner pays $3.95 for priority shipping & confirmation. We do not use priority mail for smaller items such as miniatures, pin-back buttons, photos, etc. The postage for these items is $2.50 for U.S. and Canada. For your convenience and savings we will combine postage for multiple purchases. We accept money orders, BidPay and personal checks. Personal checks must clear before shipment is made. Outside the USA please inquire by email. WE DO NOT ACCEPT CASH THROUGH THE MAIL! NYS residents please pay 8.25 % sales tax.Good luck to all! And do check out our other great auctions. Item.Name: The Producers Mel Brooks signed Book + Meehan
Item.Description: I just returned from the extremely crowded and well attended booksigning by Mel Brooks and Tom Meehan at the Barnes and Noble store at Rockerfeller Center here in NYC where I acquired a few of these signed books. This dynamic duo was signing copies of their new book "The Producers: The Biggest Hit in the History of Broadway, How We Did It." The Producers is perhaps the hottest Broadway show of all time. You can't even think about getting tickets from the box office. People around the city are paying anything to get their hands on these tickets in any location. This is all of course the result of the comic genius of the legendary Mel Brooks. He has done countless comic classics like Blazing Saddles, History of the World, ect. Nothing has brought him more success than The Producers with its astonishing and unprecedented 12 Tony awards. This wonderful coffee table style book describes the play in detail with song lyrics, pictures and lines. It is an unforgettable volume on this once and a lifetime play. This would make a spectacular christmas gift for anyone who can or cannot make it to see this great play. I will be posting photos of Mel and Tom signing and of the book in a few hours if it is not up when you read this. I will include a flyer from Barnes and Noble as proof of the signing. Who knows what it will sell for the cover price alone on the book was $40. You don't want to miss this one. You can easily have this in time for christmas with timely payment. Shipping for this heavy book is $6.50. E-mail all questions. PAYPAL available, but NO CREDIT CARDS. Here is a review of the Book from Barnes and Noble.com Mel Brooks once again delights audiences with his ingenious, infectiously, irreverent humor, knocking 'em dead on Broadway with the hottest ticket in town, The Producers. Brooks's raucous musical comedy, with the impossibly charismatic duo Max Bialystock (Nathan Lane) and Leo Bloom (Matthew Broderick) as the wily producers who cook the books and conspire to produce the worst musical ever, has won an unprecedented twelve Tony Awards (including best musical, best direction, best actor, and best original score for Brooks) and has been hailed "a gift from the show-biz gods" (Time magazine). This is the definitive account of a once-in-a-lifetime show. With characteristic candor, Mel Brooks and co-librettist Tom Meehan give an intimate glimpse of the musical Brooks calls his "love letter to Broadway." They explain the process of turning an idea into a show and detail how the creative team, which includes director/choreographer Susan Stroman and musical arranger Glen Kelly, has made The Producers into a smash hit. This lavishly illustrated book presents the libretto of the musical, in addition to such treats as annotated excerpts and never-before-seen outtakes. It contains Brooks's Tony Award-winning original songs, plus a hilarious send-up of Oklahoma! that never made it to the stage, entitled Hey, Nebraska! This book is a thrilling collection of brilliant costume and set illustrations, gorgeous photographs of scenes from the production and rehearsals, and personal photographs and anecdotes from the cast and crew. The Producers: The Book, Lyrics, and Story behind the Biggest Hit in Broadway History! pays tribute to the genius of the show, capturing permanently the magic and wild hilarity of this Broadway phenomenon. Item.Name: Rogers ARCADIAN Figural Silver 3 pieces
Item.Description: Here are three pieces of silverplated flatware in the popular Arcadian pattern, introduced in 1884 by Rogers. This lot includes a master butter knife, a luncheon fork, and a sugar or ice cream spoon. The master butter knife is about 7 1/2 inches long and has never been monogrammed. It has very heavy plate wear to both sides of the blade. The pattern shows a man holding a cup and a bunch of grapes. The pattern is crisp on this piece. The luncheon fork is about 7 inches long and has never been monogrammed. It has been professionally replated and the tines have been evened out (filed down). The pattern shows a woman in a toga-style dress. There is some wear to the pattern on this piece, but you can still see the folds in the woman's dress. The spoon is about 5 13/16 inches long and has never been monogrammed. It is probably a sugar spoon, but could be an ice cream spoon. It does have a lot of plate wear (especially to the heel of the spoon, where it rests on the table) and some pitting. The pattern shows a figure playing pan-pipes. There is some wear to the pattern. (I will enclose a list of silver repair and replating companies along with this lot. If you want this list but aren't interested in bidding on thid auction, just email me and ask, and I'll be glad to email you the list. Buyer pays $4.75 shipping in the U.S. (Priority mail, Insured), international shipping is extra. Shipped when check clears. This set is returnable within 30 days if you're not happy with it. Item.Name: Old Movie Star Scrapbook-1933/118 Pages
Item.Description: if (navigator.appName == 'Microsoft Internet Explorer') { if (navigator.appVersion.substring(0,1) "); } else { document.write(" "); document.write(" "); document.write(" BODY { background: url(http://pages.prodigy.net/ckorn/whitemar.jpg) }"); document.write(" "); document.write(" "); } } else { //Default to Netscape settings. document.write(" "); } Old Movie Star Scrapbook-1933/118 Pages Old Movie Scrapbook - Not in a traditional book - this is in one of those old University Composition Books - Measures 10 x 7 1/2" - There are 118 pages and newspaper and magazine clippings are lovingly pasted to all the pages!! Written on the cover - MARCH - APRIL AND MAY, 1933. Movies include THE BARBARIAN, MEN MUST FIGHT, SECRETS AND MORE - - MOVIE STARS INCLUDE MARY PICKFORD, FRANCHOT TONE, MARION DAVIES, GEORGE RAFT,CLARK GABLE, CLAUDETTE COLBERT AND MANY MANY MORE! In VG+ condition. I have other Clifton Webb, Greta Garbo, Spencer Tracy, Motion Picture, Hollywood and Celebrity items on auction. If you know someone who is a 1930's Movie Fan - Please let them know about this auction - or consider this as a gift for the Holidays. This is from the Estate of Clifton Webb - his personal secretary was a Huge Movie Fan and was meticulous in keeping scrapbooks and clippings. I have other items from the Estate and a couple more scrapbooks and some photos on auction, please check them out. My thoughts and prayers go out to any who have been touched by our tragedy on September 11th - and to our military men and women who have been called upon to protect this great country. God Bless America. Thank you for looking. Ruby Lane Antiques & Collectibles NO RESERVE! Buyer to pay shipping/handling and insurance if desired. These are two different things I'm asking you to do. I'm really not just being difficult - after four years and 6,000+ sales in ebay I have learned that I do need both of them. If you know you have a vacation or business trip coming up or will just be overwhelmed with other things that will interfere with contacting or paying me on time please get in touch with me ahead of time - I will be glad to talk about letting you take longer as long as I'm asked first. If you have questions feel free to ask. I am an ebay Power Seller, and try really really hard to make sales easy and fun for my winners. But if you're not going to pay me on time or contact me on time and are not going to ask for extra time either then please don_t bid - I do cancel sales; and I do give negative feedback to people who earn it, as a warning to other sellers; and I would be happier getting a few bucks less from someone else and not having to be mean. Item.Name: 6253 Cityscape Oil on Canvas
Item.Description: Original Oil No Reserve A painting does not have to be by a listed artist for me to like it. My interests are quite eclectic. Floral, landscapes, portraits beach scenes, Victorian, impressionistic, No, you certainly won_t find any Old Master paintings here, nor will you find many listed artists. _ If I see a work of a particular artist, that I like, I will pick up a painting or two. Sometimes I don_t get around to _hanging_ it for quite a while. _ Sometimes it_s just hard to find the right spot, since I don_t like _clutter_. _ I do not like prints or reproductions of any kind. To me, they just look tacky. _ I do believe the purchase of a fine painting should be approached with care. Sometimes I have made the wrong selection, much to my regret. In addition, sometimes the colors just don_t seem to come out the _same_ on the computer screen. If you purchase this painting, _ I would like for you to be happy at the time of purchase and for many years to come. Hang your new painting. See if it "fits", you, your decor, and your expectations. If for ANY reason you should be unhappy with your purchase, return it within 30 days and a full refund, less shipping charges, will be made. I believe that to be fair. Good luck. _ Original oil on canvas painting, painted by contemporary artist. This painting measures 8_ x 10_. _ The painting is being sold _unframed_, so you can select your own frame. This painting fits in a _standard_ 8_ x 10_ inch frame, so custom framing would be unnecessary. _No Reserve. _Shipping will be _ $5.00. There is NO _handling charge. _ If you purchase more than one painting, I will combine the paintings in one shipment in order to save you additional shipping charges. One painting or a hundred you still only pay $5.00. This is a US auction only. Due to recent events, I don_t recommend shipments to foreign addresses. There is a MINIMUM charge of $15.00 for foreign shipment and there could be considerable delays in receiving your paintings. PayPal accepted. Verified account: elcolorado@aol.com _ Payment Details See item description and Payment Instructions, or contact seller for more information. Payment Instructions See item description or contact seller for more information.

Item.Name: RIA VALK: Gum Card (Finland) 1962
Item.Description: Ria Valk Scarce Gum Card (Finland) 1962 __ __ This card was issued in Finland by Hellas in 1962. It is card number 58 from a set of 95 cards entitled "Pop and Film Stars (II)". The front of the card shows a colored picture of Ria Valk while the back of the card has the card number, the title and a brief description in Finnish and one other language (Swedish?).The back is similar to the sample shown. The card was given as a free premium with the purchase of gum. The size of this card is approximately 2.1 x 3.2 inches. This card, which is printed on thin stock (like a sticker) was intended to be mounted in a special album and the cards are usually found pasted down or with a glue residue on the card. It is therefore difficult to obtain cards like this one which is in highly collectible condition and has never been mounted in an album This 39 year old card is in Excellent to Near Mint condition. Postage and packing is $1.00 For any number of items! To anywhere in the world! Cards are packed in plastic holders between firm sheets of cardboard. Item.Name: PERNELL ROBERTS (BONANZA): Gum Card 1962
Item.Description: Pernell Roberts (Bonanza) Scarce Gum Card (Finland) 1962 __ __ This card was issued in Finland by Hellas in 1962. It is card number 67 from a set of 95 cards entitled "Pop and Film Stars (II)". The front of the card shows a colored picture of Pernell Roberts (Bonanza) while the back of the card has the card number, the title and a brief description in Finnish and one other language (Swedish?).The back is similar to the sample shown. The card was given as a free premium with the purchase of gum. The size of this card is approximately 2.1 x 3.2 inches. This card, which is printed on thin stock (like a sticker) was intended to be mounted in a special album and the cards are usually found pasted down or with a glue residue on the card. It is therefore difficult to obtain cards like this one which is in highly collectible condition and has never been mounted in an album This 39 year old card is in Excellent to Near Mint condition. Postage and packing is $1.00 For any number of items! To anywhere in the world! Cards are packed in plastic holders between firm sheets of cardboard. For further information please contact Phil To view our other eBay auctions click here. I accept PayPal payments! Item.Name: Austin Powers "Dr. Evil's Speech" Poster!
Item.Description: DR EVIL'S SPEECH POSTER! Here's Dr. Evil's hilarious speech from the first film! This is a commercial poster. Poster measures 23" x35" and comes in brand new rolled condition. The speech reads: "The details of my life are quite inconsequential... Very well, where do I begin? My father was a relentlessly self-improving boulangerie owner from Belgium with low grade narcolepsy and a penchant for buggery. My mother was a fifteen year old french prostitute named Chloe with webbed feet. My father would womanize, he would drink. He would make outrageous claims like he invented the question mark. Sometimes he would accuse chestnuts of being lazy. The sort of general malaise that only the genius possess and the insane lament. My childhood was typical. Summers in Rangoon, luge lessons. In the spring, we'd make meat helmets. When I was insolent I was placed in a burlap bag and beaten with reeds - pretty standard really. At the age of twelve I received my first scribe. At the age of fourteen a Zoroastrian named Vilma ritualistically shaved my testicles. There really is nothing like a shorn scrotum... it's breathtaking - I suggest you try it." Item.Name: WALT DISNEY Autographed DELL COMIC BOOK
Item.Description: WALT DISNEY (1901-1966) This is a WALT DISNEY Autographed and Signed Dell 10 Cent Disney Comic Book. He was a Film animator, producer. Born December 5, 1901 in Chicago, Illinois, the fourth of five children. Disney was raised on a Midwestern farm in Marceline, Missouri, and in Kansas City, where he was able to acquire some rudimentary art instruction from correspondence courses and Saturday museum classes. He would later use many of the animals and characters that he knew from that Missouri farm in his cartoons. He dropped out of high school at the age of 17 to serve in World War I. After serving briefly overseas as an ambulance driver, Disney returned in 1919 to Kansas City for an apprenticeship as a commercial illustrator and later made primitive animated advertising cartoons. By 1922, he had set up his own shop in association with Ub Iwerks, whose drawing ability and technical inventiveness were prime factors in Disney's eventual success. Initial failure sent Disney to Hollywood in 1923, where in partnership with his loyal elder brother Roy, he managed to resume cartoon production. His first success came with the creation of Mickey Mouse in Steamboat Willie. Steamboat Willie was the first fully synchronized sound cartoon and featured Disney as the voice of a character first called "Mortimer Mouse." Disney's wife, Lillian, suggested that Mickey sounded better and Disney agreed. Living frugally, he reinvested profits to make better pictures. His insistence on technical perfection and his unsurpassed gifts as story editor quickly pushed his firm ahead. The invention of such cartoon characters as Mickey Mouse, Donald Duck, Minnie, and Goofy combined with the daring and innovative use of music, sound, and folk material (as in The Three Little Pigs) made the Disney shorts of the 1930s a phenomenon of worldwide success. This success led to the establishment of immensely profitable, Disney-controlled sidelines in advertising, publishing, and franchised goods, which helped shape popular taste for nearly 40 years. Disney rapidly expanded his studio facilities to include a training school where a whole new generation of animators developed and made possible the production of the first feature-length cartoon, Snow White (1937). Other costly animated features followed, including Pinocchio, Bambi, and the celebrated musical experiment Fantasia. With Seal Island (1948), wildlife films became an additional source of income, and in 1950 his use of blocked funds in England to make pictures like Treasure Island led to what became the studio's major product, live-action films, which practically cornered the traditional "family" market. Eventually the Disney formula emphasized slick production techniques. It included, as in his biggest hit, Mary Poppins, occasional animation to project wholesome, exciting stories heavily laced with sentiment and, often, music. In 1954, Disney successfully broke into television. By the time of his death, the Disney studio's output amounted to 21 full-length animated films, 493 short subjects, 47 live-action films, seven True-Life Adventure features, 330 hours of Mickey Mouse Club television programs, 78 half-hour Zorro television adventures, and 280 other television shows. On July 18, 1957, Disney opened Disneyland, a gigantic projection of his personal fantasies in Anaheim, California, which has proved the most successful amusement park in history with 6.7 million people visiting it by 1966. The idea for the park came to him after taking his children to other amusement parks and watching them have fun on amusement rides. He decided to build a park where the entire family could have fun together. In 1971, Disney World, in Orlando, Florida, opened. Since then, Disney theme parks have opened in Tokyo and Paris. Disney had also dreamed of developing a city of the future, a dream that was realized in 1982 with the opening of the Center for Experimental Prototype Community of Tomorrow (EPCOT). EPCOT Center, which cost an initial $900 million, was conceived of as a real-life community of the future with the very latest in high technology. The two principle areas of EPCOT are Future World and World Showcase, both of which were designed to appeal to adults rather than children. In addition to his theme parks, Disney created and endowed a new university, the California Institute of the Arts, known as Cal Arts. He thought of this as the ultimate in education for the arts, where people in many different disciplines could work together, dream and develop, and create the mixture of arts needed for the future. Disney once commented: "It's the principle thing I hope to leave when I move on to greener pastures. If I can help provide a place to develop the talent of the future, I think I will have accomplished something." Disney's parks continue to grow with the creation of the Disney-MGM Studios, Animal Kingdom, and a extensive sports complex in Orlando. The Disney Corporation has also branched out into other types of films with the creation of Touchstone Films, into music with Hollywood Records, and even vacationing with its Disney Cruise Lines. In all, the Disney name now lends itself to a multi-billion dollar enterprise, with multiple undertakings all over the world. In 1939, Disney received an honorary Academy Award and in 1954 he received four Academy Awards. In 1965, President Lyndon B. Johnson presented Disney with the Presidential Medal of Freedom and in the same year Disney was awarded the Freedom Foundation Award. Happily married for 41 years, this moody, deliberately "ordinary" man was moving ahead with his plans for gigantic new outdoor recreational facilities when he died of circulatory problems on December 15, 1966, at St. Joseph's Hospital in Los Angeles, California. At the time of his death, his enterprises had garnered him respect, admiration, and a business empire worth over $100 million-a-year, but Disney was still remembered primarily as the man who had created Mickey Mouse over two decades before. This is a True Rare and Authentic Item. This item comes with a Certificate Of Authenticity from Sport Cards Toys & Antiquities a Member of The UACC, IACC and The Manuscript Society in Good Standing! This certificate guarantees this Signature for Life. The COA provides the buyer with a lifetime guaranty. That means, if AT ANY TIME after purchase you provide us with a written statement from a qualified examiner who questions the authenticity of any autograph, we will refund the purchase price upon the return of the autograph. Item.Name: ROSENCRANTZ AND GUILDENSTERN ARE DEAD vhs A+
Item.Description: This is a nice example of "Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead" on VHS. The original tape looks good and plays great, and the original box is nice too (some overall shelfware, and edge and corner scuffing, but nice and sturdy otherwise). Tim Roth, Richard Dreyfuss and Gary Oldman star in this classic adaptation of the Tom Stoppard play, based on two minor characters from Shakespeare's Hamlet. Color, NTSC, 117 mins. All videos are FACTORY ORIGINALS. I don't sell copies or dubs EVER. Buyer pays an additional $4.00 shipping in the U.S. or Canada_anywhere else in the world shipping is $9 for international airmail. IMPORTANT SHIPPING NOTE: I WILL BE LEAVING TOWN FOR A WEEK ON SATURDAY 12/22 RIGHT AFTER I CHECK THAT DAY'S MAIL. SO IF YOU WANT YOUR ITEM SHIPPED IMMEDIATELY, I MUST RECEIVE YOUR PAYMENT BY THEN. OTHERWISE THERE WILL BE A ONE WEEK DELAY IN SHIPPING WHILE I AM GONE. I WOULD SUGGEST USING PAYPAL, BILLPOINT (ebay payments), BIDPAY, OR MAILING YOUR PAYMENT VIA PRIORITY MAIL OR OVERNIGHT SHIPPING. OTHERWISE IT MAY NOT GET TO ME ON TIME. IF YOU CAN'T DEAL WITH THIS, PLEASE DON'T BID, BECAUSE I DON'T WANT ANY HURT FEELINGS. I ship using US Postal Service Priority Mail (3 TO 4 days in the continental US), and securely BOX all items. Thanks for stopping by, and best of luck!!

Item.Name: Le Mans (LeMans) Steve McQueen Brand NEW!
Item.Description: (From our video warehouse. This tape is GUARANTEED to be Brand New, Mint & Original Factory Sealed!) ~ "LE MANS" ~ Starring Steve McQueen, Siegfried Rauch and Elga Andersen. Exciting story of Grand Prix auto racing with exceptionally fine camera work on the track in Panavision. The Le Mans Race in France goes over 24-hours on 3.4 Kilometers of cordoned country road. Every few hours the two drivers per car alternate but the challenge is brutal. In focus here is the duel between the German- Eric Stahler (Siegfied Rauch) in the Ferrai 512LM and the American- Michael Delaney (Steve McQueen) in the Gulf Team Porsche 917. Delaney is under extraordinary pressure, because the year before he caused a severe accident, in which his friend Lisa's (Elga Andersen) husband was killed. 1971, Color, 106 Minutes, VHS, HiFi Stereo, SP, Closed Captioned, FOX Video. FACTORY SEALED, BRAND NEW in Mint Condition. (No Paypal) Buyer pays $4.75 Priority Mail w/Delivery Confirmation. Out-of-USA request rate. Personal checks clear first, money orders get fast, same day shipping (Mon-Sat). We GUARANTEE every item we list on ebay to be exactly as stated. See our many VHS (always factory sealed) auctions and thanks for looking in. Payment Details See item description and Payment Instructions, or contact seller for more information. Item.Name: SHOOTIST, John Wayne - 3 US Lobby Cards *PIC*
Item.Description: Lot of 3 original 11x14-inch glossy U.S. lobby cards from the 1976 western film THE SHOOTIST, which starred John Wayne, Lauren Bacall, Ron Howard, Jimmy Stewart, Richard Boone and Hugh O'Brian. The film was directed by Don Siegel. These cards #4, 6 and 7 of the set -- show great images from the film. Card #4 features a nice scene that includes Wayne, Bacall and Howard. Cards #6 and 7 each have pinholes and each have a crease in the upper right corner. These flaws do not greatly affect the main image areas, and otherwise, these cards are in VG condition. Item.Name: Muppet Christmas Carol VHS Michael Caine OOP
Item.Description: Muppet Christmas Carol VHS Michael Caine OOP Click picture to enlarge Click picture to enlarge Description: Description: Brian Henson directs his late father's creations in the Charles Dickens classic, the best known (and most oft-filmed) Christmas story of all time. Michael Caine plays the old miser Scrooge with Kermit as his long-suffering but ever-hopeful employee Bob Cratchit, Miss Piggy as Cratchit's wife, and a host of Muppets (including the Great Gonzo as an unlikely Charles Dickens) taking other primary roles in this bright, playful adaptation of the somber tale. Or at least it starts brightly enough--the anarchic humor soon settles into mirthful memories and a sense of melancholy as the ghosts of Christmas past, present, and future take Scrooge on a journey of his lonely, wasted life. Michael Caine makes a wonderful Scrooge, delightfully rediscovering the meaning of life as fantastic creations from Henson's Creature Shop (developed specially for this film) take the reins as the three ghosts. While the odd mix of offbeat humor and somber drama undercuts the power of Dickens's drama, this kid-friendly retelling makes an excellent family drama that adults and children alike can enjoy. Item.Name: TOMBSTONE Cast SIGNED Theatrical Movie Poster
Item.Description: Wyatt Earp (Kurt Russell) is a tough-as-nails cowboy, and with his wife and two brothers, is trying to settle down and try his hand at business. The rootin' tootin' wild West is a rough place, with tumble-weed and gun-slingers around every corner, and these guys are forced to take the law into their own hands. A band of whiskey swillin' bad-dudes show up, and rape, pillage, and plunder the town, and Wyatt rounds up a group of do-gooders (kinda) to help him, including Doc Holliday (Val Kilmer) & his brother_s Virgil (Sam Elliott) and Morgan (Bill Paxton) . These duster-wearing cow-pokes go one-on-one with the bad ones, and the results are some swell shoot-outs, and a few corpses in the road. It all comes down to the shoot-out at the O.K. Corral, so to speak, and who will be left standing when the dust settles and the gun-smoke clears? This is a classic Western, and many believe it to be the best Western of all time, and it's easy to see why. The realism level is very high, the movie leaves out the sugar-coated sections some Westerns use, and sticks with the grim and brutal aspects. The movie is extremely dark, sometimes pitch black, and with even the good guys clad in black, the scenes sometimes seem to be total darkness. It is very cohesive to the film to have this darker tone, because this movie shoots for a grittier, Hollywood-less Old West. Don_t miss out on your chance to own this awesome 5x7 COPY of REPRODUCED Authentic Autographs from this 1993 CLASSIC at an unbelievable low minimum bid. Winning bid to add $5.00 for postage & handling. Int'l orders add a bit more. Item.Name: Quiet Thunder - June Chadwick Free Shipping!
Item.Description: AuctionWarrior wants you to know: This VHS tape original box cover has been cut to fit into a protective plastic case .. I do this to preserve the front, back, and spine graphics, and to protect the cassette for years to come. The picture above is a representation of the movie box. Actual box graphics may differ slightly or have the rental house 'tags'. Also, the graphic above contains an AuctionWarrior 'AW' logo watermark to prevent image theft. Actual video box graphics shipped do not have the watermark on them! You are bidding on an ORIGINAL RELEASE (not a low-quality copy) with NO RESERVE and you get FREE SHIPPING! Don't forget to check out our other auctions by clicking HERE. My Guarantee: If you are not pleased with your video tape purchase, e-mail me within 7 days of receipt and I will make it right with you. Bid with confidence! _ And now, all I can tell you about the film: Title: Quiet Thunder Genre: Action Tagline: (none) Format: VHS (NTSC) any American VCR will have no trouble with this._ It is NOT for PAL or SECAM (International) VCRs Film Specifics: Runtime: Germany:94_ Country: USA__ Language: English__ Color: Color__ Certification: Germany:18__ I recommend you always view VHS tapes in a top quality 4- head Hi-Fi VCR as the 2-head variety can't overcome the copy protection schemes, such as MacroVision, that most studios use to prevent you from making copies at home._ The only people to ever work out a good two head scheme were Sony, with their Beta and BetaVision systems._ It's a pity the world wasn't ready for the now extinct Beta standard._ I was superior to VHS in just about every way._ The VHS VCRs I have had good luck with personally are RCA, JVC and Mitsubishi._ All 4-head Hi-Fi versions..._ :-) _ Plot Summary(ies): A bush pilot and a senator's wife try to survive in the jungles of Africa after witnessing an assassination._ From The Box: Quiet Thunder rolls strong and steady across the African plains. A hard drinking, womanizing bush pilot and a voluptuous senators' wife become the dark continent's most hunted big game. Witnesses to political assassination, they must be tracked down and eliminated. Their desperate escape leads them across the rugges African terrain, into a world of ancient majical tribal spirits and across that invisible line between miracles and murder. (The information here was gathered using Xerox Textbridge Pro v9.0_ I highly recommend this program!) Cast: June Chadwick___ Wayne Crawford___ __ Produced by_ Joel Levine__ (executive producer)__ Barrie Saint Clair__ (producer)__ _ Terms and Conditions: AuctionWarrior only ships within the United States. Bidder must prepay before item is shipped._ I accept money orders, cashier's checks, visa/mastercard through Paypal (see the paypal banner/link below) and personal checks._ Bidders with 15+ feedback and no negatives who send personal checks will have their item(s) shipped immediately._ Otherwise, personal checks will be held until they clear and item(s) sent thereafter._ (usually about 10 days)_ If a Bidder's check bounces, bidder agrees to pay the bank fees resulting from the bounced check._ Winning bidder is to respond with email within 3 days of end of auction, and payment is due within 14 days unless otherwise arranged through email correspondence._ (if bidding on multiple auctions, payment is due 14 days from the end of the "last" winning auction to close.)_ If payment is not received within 14 days, I reserve the right to relist the item(s) and leave appropriate feedback._ Buyer pays no shipping cost, plus insurance if desired._ Shipping will be via USPS Media Rate mail unless otherwise noted._ I will combine shipping to save you money if you win multiple auctions from us._ I cannot be held responsible for uninsured items that are lost or damaged in transit, as I cannot control the USPS._ I package well, but recommend insurance for breakable items._ (Remember the Samsonite Luggage commercial?_ You just never know!)_ I always leave feedback for successfully completed transactions._ If you have any questions, please ask them BEFORE bidding by writing to fullvolume@earthlink.net FREE SHIPPING NO RESERVE NOT A COPY QUALITY GUARANTEED! _ Condition: Like most of the movies I have for sale, this one is a previously viewed movie from a rental store._ It has the traditional video store stickers, and is not shrinkwrapped._ You can tell from the pictures what movie you are getting and info about same._ The box art varies in condition, but is always in good shape unless otherwise mentioned herein._ I guarantee these to be of good quality, so BID TODAY!_ :-) Shipping: The free shipping listed in the add is for "Special Standard" mail._ Also known as "Media Rate."_ If you are in a hurry for this item, you should DEFINITELY write and ask about Priority Mail shipping instead.

Item.Name: Marilyn Monroe rare tribute Coin, Take a L@@K
Item.Description: Marilyn Monroe rare tribute Coin, Take a L@@K This is a very nice Mardi Gras Doubloon featuring Marilyn Monroe. It is from 1974 and in nice condition. Only .75 cents to ship in the U.S. A nice addition to any celebrity or sex symbol collection. I have a number of related items up for sale on eBay. If you would like to see them click here. For those of you who don t know, Mardi Gras doubloons are brightly colored aluminum coins about the size of a silver dollar. They are thrown by Krewe members from Mardi Gras floats. Doubloons usually have the symbol of the Krewe on the front along with the date the Krewe was organized, the back side usually has the theme for that years parade as well as the date. Each Krewe may have a number of different doubloons for each years parade. Usually the silver ones are the most common, followed by a range of colors from red to gold. Some Krewes mint real bronze, silver and even gold doubloons, however these are very rare and seldom put up for sale. Many Mardi Gras doubloons are fairly rare outside of New Orleans, and many are rare even in the city. They make great inexpensive yet unique collectibles or gifts. I am in the process of auctioning a number of doubloons from my collection. The subject matter of my individual doubloon auctions vary a great deal. I have coins for a lot of different themes. If you would like to see my other coins please CLICK HERE.. Shipping is only $.75 cents in the United States. Buy a number of coins and save on shipping. Thank you for looking at my auction, and have a nice day. NO RESERVE! Shipping for one doubloon is .75 cents. I do combine shipping on auctions to save you money, so bid on as many auctions as you like, and I will save you money on shipping. Please click here to see the other auctions I have posted on eBay. I have hundreds of different coins with a wide variety of themes available. This listing created by eBay Seller's Assistant Basic.

Item.Name: ROBERT WARWICK Original Studio Photo Negative
Item.Description: ~ ROBERT WARWICK ~ Original Studio Negative!!! Vintage Piece Of Hollywood Memorabilia!! ********************************************* ********************************************* HOLLYWOOD Movie Star, leading man & character actor from silent era into 1950's. Including The Adventures Of Robin Hood, Sullivans Travels & I Married A Witch, among others. ROBERT WARWICK original studio contact print negative is 5" X 7" ( CAN BE PRINTED IN LARGER SIZES ), condition is excellent. I used the computer to make a crude picture from the negative, it will print much nicer. YOU ARE BIDDING ON THE ORIGINAL 5X7 CONTACT PRINT NEGATIVE, NOT MY COMPUTER GENERATED PICTURE FROM THE NEGATIVE! This is a working negative that was used to produce photos sent to fans who wrote to the stars. It is 60+ to 70+ years old! Please check out my other auctions. This is part of a collection I aquired in the 1980's from a gentleman named Hal, who owned a used book & memorabilia shop in Southern California. Hal had connections in the industry and found out that original contact print negatives, fan photos & other great stuff was being thrown out. The negatives & pictures were from the silent era to the 1940's, and mostly fan photos with autographs printed from the negatives. This was in the 1950's and Hal sold this stuff for years. He sold me most of the negatives along with some other goodies. I've been selling them on eBay for the last two years. These contact print negatives can be printed in larger sizes. $3.00 insured shipping. Pay Pal (VISA & MASTERCARD), Checks (held 10 days)& Money Orders Accepted. Item.Name: OVER THE RAINBOW TO OZ, 1971 Wiz. of Oz COIN
Item.Description: OVER THE RAINBOW TO OZ, 1971 Wiz. of Oz COIN This is a great and rare Mardi Gras doubloon. It shows the city of Oz along with the yellow brick road. It shows all of the characters including Dorty, Toto, The Tin Man, The Cowardly Lion, etc. A steal at this price and only .75 cents to ship in the U.S. in a protective sleeve. I have a number of Wizard of Oz related items up for sale on eBay. If you would like to see them click here. The Wizard of Oz (1939) Director: Victor Fleming Cast: Judy Garland, Ray Bolger, Jack Haley, Bert Lahr, Margaret Hamilton and Billie Burke For those of you who don t know, Mardi Gras doubloons are brightly colored aluminum coins about the size of a silver dollar. They are thrown by Krewe members from Mardi Gras floats. Doubloons usually have the symbol of the Krewe on the front along with the date the Krewe was organized, the back side usually has the theme for that years parade as well as the date. Each Krewe may have a number of different doubloons for each years parade. Usually the silver ones are the most common, followed by a range of colors from red to gold. Some Krewes mint real bronze, silver and even gold doubloons, however these are very rare and seldom put up for sale. Many Mardi Gras doubloons are fairly rare outside of New Orleans, and many are rare even in the city. They make great inexpensive yet unique collectibles or gifts. I am in the process of auctioning a number of doubloons from my collection. The subject matter of my individual doubloon auctions vary a great deal. I have coins for a lot of different themes. If you would like to see my other coins please CLICK HERE.. Shipping is only $.75 cents in the United States. Buy a number of coins and save on shipping. Thank you for looking at my auction, and have a nice day. NO RESERVE! Shipping for one doubloon is .75 cents. I do combine shipping on auctions to save you money, so bid on as many auctions as you like, and I will save you money on shipping. Please click here to see the other auctions I have posted on eBay. I have hundreds of different coins with a wide variety of themes available. This listing created by eBay Seller's Assistant Basic.

Inserts were one of the standard poster sizes printed by the studios until the mid 1980s. In 1985 all of the studios discontinued printing inserts. Cast includes: P. Casnoff, F. Drescher, D. Item.Name: Antique Shaving Stand Mirror Derby Silver
Item.Description: This silver plated shaving stand is marked on the bottom, "Derby Silver Co. 6858". It stands 14 1/2" high. The mirror is 5 5/8" in diameter and the bottom of the base is 5 1/2" in diameter. The base has a victorian design of cherubs and flowers. Some of the cherubs are playing musical instruments. The back of the mirror also has a beautiful design of flowers and scroll. The mirror is beveled and the silvering on the edge of the glass mirror has gone bad in some areas. I would think this would be fairly normal in an antique shaving mirror of this type. The base has the original milk glass incert that is in perfect condition. The stand also has an early Blue Ribbon wood handled shaving brush with it. The brush has a hairline crack at the base of the wood handle. Other than the flaws on the edge of the mirror, the stand is in excellent condition but could use a good polishing. High bid to pay $6 for priority mail with confirmation delivery. Insurance, if desired, is extra. If you cannot pay within 12 days, PLEASE do not bid. Payment I accept the following forms of payment: Money Order, Personal Check. Item.Name: 10 COMMANDMENTS 8x10 still Yvonne DeCarlo
Item.Description: Title: 10 COMMANDMENTS 8x10 still Yvonne DeCarlo What You Are Bidding On: 8x10 still Film Description: the 1956 Cecil B. DeMille epic starring Charlton Heston, Edward G. Robinson, Yul Brynner, Yvonne DeCarlo, John Derek, Debra Paget, Sir Cedric Hardwick Condition: fine. There are a few minor creases in the edges. All our stills are original theater 8x10s (re-issues are noted before the film description). Some may measure slightly smaller than 8x10 (in which case, you should see the image and compare the still to the ruler in the picture). View our other auctions and bid away, remember that you pay only one shipping charge (as long as it all fits in one package)! Shipping Terms: Your shipping cost on this item is $4 (non-US generally pays $10). Your item will be mailed Priority mail through the United States Post Office. Insurance is NOT included. Insurance is an extra $1.10. We can not be responsible for the package if you don't pay for insurance. We use the boxes that the Post Office provides. We are always trying to determine new ways to ship your items cheaper but in such a way that the items are received in the condition described. We'd like to think that each package you receive from us will be better than the last! Payment Options: You can pay with PayPal (preferred), check, or money order. I do NOT accept eBay checkout or Billpoint/eBay Payments. If that option shows up, please disregard it as I simply don't accept it. Return Policy: If the item is not in the condition we have described, let us know within 5 days and we'll refund your bid and shipping both ways. Contact us first whenever you have a problem. Why Our Auctions Instead of Someone Else's? We try to accurately describe the condition of what we sell, most times making it sound worse than it really is. The reason we do this is that we've purchased way too many items that say "Fine to Near Mint" when it was really in "good to very good" condition. We don't think you should have to deal with that kind of mentality. Unlike other sellers you may have dealt with, we know what it is to be a collector! When we say that an item is "original" we mean that it IS original. Many other sellers don't realize that there is a difference between "Theater" and "Video" or "Original release" and "reissue". We know all that stuff. When we claim an item is something, it is what we claim. If you EVER buy an item and find that we misdescribed it as something it isn't, send it back for a full refund. This means you don't have to worry about whether the item is really a theater poster or a video poster. US or Australian. Spanish or Mexican. So, bid with confidence! We have movie paper available every week! Be sure to visit our auctions every week as we have tons of movie memorabilia! We start all our movie paper at $.99 and most of our non-movie items at $.99 as well! Bid on all you want and, as long as it fits in one package, pay only one shipping fee (non-US orders pay actual shipping)! Follow this link to visit our About Me Page for more details on why we are your best choice for eBay purchases Note that sometimes it is difficult to get a good image of an item. Some images may have glare but the glare is NOT part of the actual item.

NASH BRIDGES (1996-2001) Starring Don Johnson, Cheech Marin, Jodi Lyn O'Keefe, Jeff Perry, Stone Cold Steve Austin, Yasmine Bleeth, Caroline Lagerfelt, Angela Dohrmann, Stephen Berra, Daniel Roebuck and many, many more. The show also featured an impressive list of guests, such as Traci Lords, Lucy Lui, Jan Michael Vincent, Willie Nelson and others. Thanks to Rysher Entertainment and Nash Bridges Productions we are now able to offer collectible costumes and props from this long running comedy/action hit television show! All items will be accompanied by a Certificate Of Authenticity signed by the production company. The costume designer for the show was Richard Von Ernst, who custom made the costumes for Nash, Joe and Caitlin. The costume manufacturer was, "High Society". According to the 6th Season Nash Family, Don Johnson measured in at 5'10" and his suits were a 42R. Shirt size is 16/34, pants 35/32 and his shoe size was a 10 _. Cheech Marin measured in at 5'7" and his suit size is a 42S. Shirt size is 15.5/32, pants 35/28 and his shoe size is always an 8. For more information on the cast and crew, log on to www.nashbridges.com. All auctions are held with NO reserve so take this opportunity to own a very special piece of Hollywood History from the long running hit show_NASH BRIDGES! Item.Name: JANET MUNRO On Knees Bare Midriff Photo!
Item.Description: .titledata { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; font-size:17px; color:#00000; font-weight : bold; } .description { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; color:#636145; background-color : #ffffff; } .link { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; font-size:12px; underline; } HR { color: #000000; } JANET MUNRO On Knees Bare Midriff Photo! Nice 8 X 10 B&W glossy photo of actress JANET MUNRO in shorts and halter top. British actress Janet Munro was the daughter of a stage comedian who, during World War 2, was in charge of the RAF entertainment unit. Janet's popular on British TV of the 1950s was such that one prominent fan magazine, responding to public demand, voted her "Miss Television of 1958". Signed by Disney in 1959, Janet played spirited ingenue roles in Darby O'Gill and the Little People (1959), Third Man on the Mountain (1959), Swiss Family Robinson (1960) and The Horsemasters (released to American television in 1961 and to European theatres shortly thereafter). Once away from the Disney orbit, Janet radically altered her screen image with a string of sexy, fallen-woman roles; her final film assignment was as the fading alcoholic pop star in Sebastian (1968). Her success in show business was in sharp contrast to her extraordinarily unhappy private life, which included two failed marriages to actors Tony Wright and Ian Hendry and two miscarriages. Janet Munro collapsed and died at age 38, reportedly choking to death while drinking tea. The official cause of death is listed as acute myocarditis. _ Hal Erickson PLEASE READ: I do not utilize at this time the optional "checking out" feature displayed on my item description page by EBAY. The buyer will continue to receive a close of auction notice from my management service AUCTIONWATCH. PLEASE disregard the "checkout feature" provided by EBAY. SHARPIES DOES NOT APPEAR ON ACTUAL PHOTO. This is a true, actual photo from a negative and NOT a computer generated scan. To the best of our knowledge, this photo does not infringe on any copyright laws. Item.Name: COLT 1911-A1 BLACK COMMANDER SEMI-AUTO GUN
Item.Description: Colt 1911 - A1 Commander Replica Black Semi-Automatic Pistol 30 years after the introduction of the Colt .45 1911 Government model, World War II started and thereafter came the ultimate testing ground for the service pistol. Arming soldiers and officers as a self-defense weapon in the Pacific and in Europe, the .45 1911-A1 model passed the battlefield "tests" with flying colors. Some 7 years after the war had ended; the U.S. military brass considered the .45 cartridge an effective round but that the full-sized Government model that fired it was too large for officers and others of high rank to easily carry. Keeping the caliber and capacity, the model 1911-A1 was shortened by 5/8 of an inch, manufactured with lighter alloys and named after the personnel it was designed for, the Commander appeared and was praised. This high quality model has authentic details and is built to 1:1 scale. Working slide, trigger, magazine and release. There is a full-length slide travel on this replica. Realistic removable magazine. Open combat sights. Color is black, and the finish appears as the genuine article. Length is about 8 inches. Pistol comes NEW, mint in box with instructions, and removable full size clip. The 1911-A1 Commander is one of the most realistic and most detailed replicas available. In fact, many movies and TV Series actually use guns such as these as back up and throw down pieces because of their detail and inexpensive nature. Why destroy a $500 steel blank firing prop when you can have the same amount of detail at well less than half the cost? This replica is composed of tough ABS polymer and metal parts. Because of the 1911-A1 Commander _s realistic appearance we don't recommend carrying this item in public. Sold for display or film and theatrical prop purposes only! This item complies with ATF requirements, including orange barrel tip. No license or permit is required! It is the responsibility of the bidder to insure that this item be bought and used in accordance with your state and local laws. It cannot fire real bullets, and never could. This baby will fool your friends for sure! Please be at least 18 years old. Winner pays $7.25 shipping, handling, and insurance. Email me at sailor570@compuserve.com if you have any questions. Please check out my other auctions. Thank you for bidding. I accept VISA & MASTER CARD credit car d payments with PayPal. Its FAST, EASY, SECURE and FREE! Just click on this button to sign up! I also accept cash, checks, or money orders. If payment is by PayPal, I only ship to your confirmed address. I am proud to announce that I have earned the eBay Powerseller recognition! I earned this because of a lot of hard work and GREAT customers like you! THANK YOU!! Free Honesty Counters powered by Andale! Item.Name: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me DVD
Item.Description: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me DVD Click picture to enlarge Description: Description: "I put the grrr in swinger, baby!" a deliciously randy Austin Powers coos near the beginning of The Spy Who Shagged Me, and if the imagination of Austin creator Mike Myers seems to have sagged a bit, his energy surely hasn't. This friendly, go-for-broke sequel to 1997's Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery finds our man Austin heading back to the '60s to keep perennial nemesis Dr. Evil (Myers again) from blowing up the world--and, more importantly, to get back his mojo, that man-juice that turns Austin into irresistible catnip for women, especially American spygirl Felicity Shagwell (a pretty but vacant Heather Graham). The plot may be irreverent and illogical, the jokes may be bad (with characters named Ivana Humpalot and Robin Swallows, n_e Spitz), and the scenes may run on too long, but it's all delivered sunnily and with tongue firmly in cheek. Myers's true triumph, though, is his turn as the neurotic Dr. Evil, who tends to spout the right cultural reference at exactly the wrong time (referring to his moon base as a "Death Star" with Moon Units Alpha and Zappa--in 1969). Myers teams Dr. Evil with a diminutive clone, Mini-Me (Verne J. Troyer), who soon replaces slacker son Scott Evil (Seth Green) as the apple of the doctor's eye; Myers and Troyer work magic in what could plausibly be one of the year's most affecting (and hysterically funny) love stories. Despite a stellar supporting cast--including a sly Rob Lowe as Robert Wagner's younger self and Mindy Sterling as the forbidding Frau Farbissina--it's basically Myers's show, and he pulls a hat trick by playing a third character, the obese and disgusting Scottish assassin Fat Bastard. Many viewers will reel in disgust at Mr. Bastard's repulsive antics and the scatological bent Myers indulges in, including one showstopper involving coffee and--shudder--a stool sample. Still, Myers's good humor and dead-on cultural references win the day; Austin is one spy who proves he can still shag like a minx. Item Details: _ DVD is previously viewed and in excellent condition. _ Region 1 encoding (US and Canada only) _ Color, Closed-captioned, Dolby _ Commentary by creator Mike Myers, director Jay Roach & co-writer Michael McCullers _ Theatrical trailer(s) _ Almost 20 minutes of deleted scenes _ Behind-the-scenes featurette, plus The Dr. Evil Story and Comedy Central's spy-o-graphy, a spoof of A&E's popular Biography series _ Music Videos: Beautiful Stranger by Madonna, American Woman by Lenny Kravitz and Word Up by Mel B (aka Scary Spice) _ DVD-ROM Features: Austin Powers and Dr. Evil Web Browsers and a playable demo of a trivia game by Berkeley Systems, "Austin Powers Operation" _ Widescreen anamorphic format _ Starring: Mike Myers, Heather Graham _ NTSC format (US and Canada only) Bidding means you agree to these terms; please read them. Item.Name: STERLING SILVER NEW MEXICO SOUVENIR SPOON
Item.Description: Sterling Silver Souvenir Spoon 5 3/8 inches in length from NEW MEXICO. A very clearly detailed spoon. Down the handle starting at top is the State Seal, then the word _WOOD WAGON_ then a donkey, then word _Sam Miguel Church_ then engraving of a church. Then word _NEW MEXICO_ down the handle. The bowl has the words _HOTEL ALVARADO, ALBQUERQUE, NEW MEX. The back part of the handle has fine detailing: two flowers and word _CAPITOL_ engraving of the Capitol then the words _STARVATION PEAK_ then an engraving of the peak. Then the words _ADOBE HOUSE_ then engraving of a house. Then word _TURQUOISE_ then an engraving of a person. . The sterling silver hallmark is engraved on the back handle. See photos for the details. Note: Color of spoon is silver, but pictures may not be accurate from camera lighting.

Item.Description: This is a fabulous ad of Reba McEntire Thomas Ian Griffith and ROnny Cox Mpw out of print and impossible to find. These ads are placed in entertainment industry publications that are not available outside of the Hollywood circle. They go out of print quickly making them rise in value. Each ad has been carefully removed. Ads are placed in a protective plastic sleeve and are ready for framing or a collector's book. Size is about 8.25 x 11. Buyer to pay $2.00 shipping and handling in the US. Good luck! You may pay by cash check money order or PayPal. Paypal is an online payment. *About Trade Ads-FAQ* Trade ads are advertisements run in various entertainment trade publications for the purpose of promoting a film, performer, musician, actor or to celebrate a particular achievement. These ads are very carefully removed from various publications, both domestic and international, and carefully shipped to you. They are published in a variety of sizes (note description), and on various paper stocks from heavyweight card stock to glossy magazine paper stock to color newsprint. These ads have become highly sought after by collectors primarily due to the unique artwork utilized by the ad's promoter. These ads often are created for limited distribution, sometimes running only on a single occasion, so generally unique and dynamic artwork is created--artwork that stands apart from that used in traditional consumer-retail campaigns. They are most often framed or matted by collectors, or sometimes stored in scrapbooks. Once these collectibles are framed or matted, particularly the 11" x 14" variety, they are often mistaken for mini-posters. Multi-page ads vary from ad to ad. Some multi-page ads are conjoined while some are separate pages. Please inquire if this is important to you. Item.Name: Tragic CAROLE LOMBARD Classy Suit Photo!Nice!
Item.Description: .titledata { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; font-size:17px; color:#00000; font-weight : bold; } .description { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; color:#636145; background-color : #ffffff; } .link { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; font-size:12px; underline; } HR { color: #000000; } Tragic CAROLE LOMBARD Classy Suit Photo!Nice! Splendid 8 X 10 B&W glossy photo of stunning beauty CAROLE LOMBARD. Carole Lombard was born Jane Alice Peters in Fort Wayne, Indiana on October 6, 1908. Her parents divorced in 1916 and Carole's mother took the family on a trip out West. While there they decided to settle down in the Los Angeles area in California. After being spotted playing baseball in the street with the neighborhood boys by a film director, Carole was signed to a one picture contract in 1921 when she was 12. The film in question was A PERFECT CRIME. Although she tried for other acting jobs, she would not be seen again for four years. For the time being she returned to a normal life, going to school and participating in athletics at which she was very good particularly track and field. At 15, Carole had had enough of school and quit. She joined a theater troupe and played in several stage shows, which were for the most part nothing to write home about. In 1925, she passed a screen test and was signed to a contract with 20th Century Fox. Her first role as a Fox player was HEARTS AND SPURS where she had the lead. Right after that film Carole appeared in a western called DURAND OF THE BADLANDS. She rounded out 1925 in the comedy MARRIAGE IN TRANSIT. Other films that year included a number of shorts. In 1926, Carole was seriously injured in an automobile accident which left the left side of her face scarred. Once she had recovered, Fox canceled her contract. She did find work in a number of shorts during 1928 (thirteen of them), but did go back for a one time shot with Fox called ME, GANGSTER. By now, the film industry was moving from the silent era to "talkies". While some had their careers end due to sound, Carole made a very smooth transition. Her first film with sound was HIGH VOLTAGE with Pathe (her new studio employer) in 1929. In 1931, Carole was teamed with William Powell in MAN OF THE WORLD. (In fact, she married Powell, but the union was a failure with a divorce in 1933). NO MAN OF HER OWN (1932) put Carole opposite Clark Gable for the first and only time. (They married in seven years later in 1939). By now she was with Paramount Studios and was one of their top stars. But it was 1934's TWENTIETH CENTURY that showed her true comedic talents and proved to the world what a fine actress she really was. In 1936, Carole received her only Oscar nomination for Best Actress in MY MAN GODFREY. As Irene Bullock, she was superb in the role. Unfortunately, the coveted award went to Luise Ranier in THE GREAT ZIEGFELD which also won for Best Picture. She was now working about one film a year at her choosing, because she wanted any role she picked to be a good one. She was very adept at picking just the right part. And why not? She was smart enough to see through the good-ol-boy syndrome of the studio moguls. She commanded and received one of the top salaries in the business. At one time it was reported she was making $35, 000 a week. She made but one film in 1941, that being MR. & MRS. SMITH. Her last film was in 1942, when Carole played Maria Tura in TO BE OR NOT TO BE. She did not live to see its release. Finished in 1941 at the time the US entered World War II, Carole went home to Indiana for a war bond rally. On January 16, 1942, Carole, her mother, and 20 other people were flying back to California when the plane went down outside of Las Vegas, Nevada. All perished. The highly acclaimed comedy actress was dead at the age of 33 and few have been able to match her talents since. This was released prior to the first issue to generate maximum interest in the title. When properly built and colored, these look pretty good! The paper does not take water color as well as it looks like it would, I recommend high quality markers (just like Vaughn Bode used!). The sheet measures 11" x 14" and is in great shape with only very minor wear on the corners of the sheet, well outside the image area. Item.Name: Last House On the Left Employee Work Shirt XL
Item.Location: Check Out My Other UNIQUEAuctions! WDC
Item.Description: Last House On the Left Employee Work Shirt XL I've always had a great love for the Drive-In. Though I wasn't around during the Drive-In's heyday I got to see my fair share of them in the late 1970's. In fact years earlier I saw my first "on screen" booby at a Drive-In. As a kid coming home from a family restaurant we always passed this run down Drive-In, and every time we would pass it at night I would gaze with anticipation to see something- ANYTHING I wasn't supposed too see! Well one evening IT happend, as my dear father speed by the tattered and torn Drive-In I careened my head out the window, strained my eyes and there it was, in all of its glory a 5 story high boob- JACKPOT!!! Too this day I still have no idea what movie was playing but that awesome childhood memory (or should that be mammoire!) I hold dear in my heart to this day! Oh yes the DRIVE-INs, I love everything about them, from the bad speaker sound the loud drunks yelling stiff at the enormous screen, the laughter of the children playing in the mini-playground, the young lovers steamed up windows and the Concession stands tasty steamed Hot Dogs and Popcorn that was so greasy you were guaranteed a face full of pimples in the morning! Sadly the Drive-In days are pretty much over and a full resurgence too its 1950's heyday is little more than wishful thinking! But we all can dream can't we? So here I introduce you too the coolest line of shirts I've ever seen! Yes, an actual *New* Drive-In Movie Theater Work Shirt! These really have to seen to be believed! They are exactly what you would have worn if YOU were an employee of the "Starlight Drive-In" in Baltimore, Maryland (home of John Waters!). This is a NEW and NEVER BEEN WORN employee button-up, collared work shirt! Screen printed over the right side pocket is the AWSOME "Starlight Drive-In" logo, complete with Baltimore, Maryland printed below! Now on the right hand sleeve is an advertisement for the Starlight_s Weekly Special- a little theater cartoon man screams: "REMEMBER! $2 Car Loads Every Tuesday!" This was a common practice by Drive-In's all across the country to entice you and as many of your friends you can CRAM in your moms_ car (we could 5 people in the trunk!) to come to the theater during the weekdays! Now my FAVORITE part of the shirt, screen-printed on the left-hand sleeve is the theater advertisement for the Concession Stand! It reads _Visit our CONCESSION STAND! Ice-Cold Drinks, Fresh Popcorn, Delicious Hot Dogs_- complete with little illustrations of Dancing Food, much like you'd see in the INTERMISION cartoon the theater would run during the middle of the movie! Below these characters it reads: "It's Always A Good Time for a Treat!" Oh yes, truer words have never been spoken! Now on the back of this particular shirt is an advertisement for the "The Last House on the Left." Can a Drive-In work shirt go too far? The back of this "Killer" Starlight Drive-In employee work shirt is an ad for the ground breaking Wes Craven rape/revenge film "Last House on the Last". Wes (an ex-high school teacher!) directed this exploitation clasSICK in 1972, and it contains scenes so sick, shocking, and vile that they hold their own to any modern day splatter flick! After viewing this film you just feel dirty and have the urge to take a shower- only a handful of movies ever made can spawn this weird feeling! This Drive-In employee work shirt features the three movie villains lustfully eyeing over a knife blade that is dripping wet with fresh blood! Oooooh sounds yummy, don't it! Surrounding this disturbing image is the now famous movie hype that many an exploitation film has used since. Now I warn you, this is a very disturbing shirt, to avoid fainting keep repeating, "It's only a Work Shirt, It's only a Work Shirt, It's only a Work Shirt _. This work shirt has an awesome vintage Drive-In feel to it and would be a great addition to any film poster, horror collector or Drive-In enthusiasts wardrobe! Bid on this or just _Buy it Now_ because I know your just _craven_ to own it! This is size XLarge and it is BRAND NEW and HAS NEVER BEEN WORN! It is collared with buttons up the front and has two front pockets! High bidder pays $4.50 Priority shipping (international rates more-email me). I'll ship the shirt out within 7-10 days (usually faster) after payment is received if paid for by a cert. check or money order-all other checks must clear (held for 10 Days) before you can start working at this Drive-In! Payment must be received within 10 days of auction end. Be sure to check out all of my other BIZARRE auctions on the Great eBay! Remember this- eBay Auctions by "1-2-3-4", Stuff You've NEVER Seen Before! See ya at the Drive-In!!!! We ship within 7-10 days(usually faster) after recieving your payment. We are closed on the weekends. So, if you email us after 5 pm on Friday we won't get back to you until the following Monday. andale andalesell Payment Options: _ Money Order / Cashier's Check , PayPal , Personal Check Shipping Options: _ Fixed Shipping Charges. USPS Priority Shipping Rate: $4.50 (Domestic) I will ship to: USA and Internationally Customer Service Policy: _ We only ship CONFIRMED USPS PRIORITY. Multiple orders get a discount. International Buyers, please note, we only ship GLOBAL PRIORITY. Please fill out our andale checkout form and we will calculate shipping for you. Be advised it costs anywhere from 5.00 to 20.00 for international shipping. Payment Policy: Personal Checks: MAKE CHECKS PAYABLE TO ANDREW D. GORE. Checks will be held for a minimum of 10 days from date received before the order is processed.Please remember to put the auction number on your checks. Money Orders: MAKE CHECKS PAYABLE TO ANDREW D. GORE Please remember to put the auction number on your checks and money orders. PayPal: Please DO NOT forget to type in your address and auction number. goreatorium A. D. Gore Thanks You for your business from the bottom of his lil' black heart If you are the winning bidder, please read the following instructions: Once this auction ends, I will send you an email within 2 hours with instructions for completing your purchase. To use my fast, easy, and secure checkout, just click on the link in the email or on the Checkout logo in this ad. At my checkout --powered by Andale-- please enter your shipping address and other information so I can calculate a final price and ship your purchase quickly. You will recieve all the information that you need to complete this transaction after you fill out the andale checkout form. International buyers will be emailed their total within 48 hours of completeing the form. Please note we do not offer insurance on international packages. andale andalecheckout Use the REAL selling tools a million sellers do - Andale!
